title: Arctic Sea Ice Decline
description: The Arctic is warming twice as fast as the global average. In September 2024, sea ice extent reached its second-lowest level on record, threatening polar ecosystems and indigenous communities.

title: Great Barrier Reef Bleaching
description: Rising ocean temperatures have caused unprecedented coral bleaching events. In 2024, over 60% of the Great Barrier Reef experienced severe bleaching, devastating marine ecosystems.

title: Amazon Rainforest Deforestation
description: Deforestation rates hit critical levels in 2024, with over 10,000 square kilometers lost. This massive carbon sink is approaching a tipping point that could transform it from a carbon absorber to a carbon emitter.

title: Greenland Ice Sheet Melting
description: The Greenland ice sheet lost a record 532 billion tons of ice in 2024. This massive melting contributes significantly to global sea level rise, threatening coastal communities worldwide.

title: Mediterranean Heat Waves
description: Record-breaking heat waves in Southern Europe reached 48.8°C (119.8°F) in 2024, causing widespread wildfires, drought, and crop failures across the region.

title: Maldives Rising Seas
description: With 80% of its 1,190 islands less than 1 meter above sea level, the Maldives faces existential threat from rising seas. Several islands have already begun implementing floating infrastructure projects.

title: California Megadrought
description: The American West experienced its worst drought in 1,200 years. Lake Powell reached historic lows, threatening water supply and hydroelectric power for millions.

title: Siberian Permafrost Thaw
description: Rapid permafrost thaw in Siberia is releasing ancient methane and carbon dioxide, creating a dangerous feedback loop in global warming. In 2024, several new methane craters were discovered.
